name: Android Developer Dark Theme
description: Google's Android Developer pages for people who want to get some work done at night. The code examples featured on the site are also redone to resemble Android Studio's (or IntelliJ's IDEA) editor colour palettes.
additional_info:
2019-08-24:
- Finally caved in and updated the theme to fix all the little annoying changes Google decided to do.
- Search bar results styling (when expanded) needs work; I'll fix it when I'm less lazy.

2019-03-03:
 - Rewrote the CSS from scratch after Google's latest website update (again!).
 - Style still needs some changes and tweaks, but it's good enough to keep working at night.

2018-07-25:
 - Minor fixes with more on the way as I discover them.

2018-05-30:
- Overflow arrow background fix.

2018-05-21:
- Minor fixes.

2018-05-20:
- Rewrote the CSS from scratch after Google's latest website update.
- Brought back the green-coloured nav bar at the top, so the site looks familiar on first glance.
- Still a work in progress, but it's good enough to keep working at night.

2018-03-14:
- New Java & Kotlin code boxes have been darkened
- Android API "P" Preview fixes

2017-10-28:
- Minor fixes for search result pages.
- Main page social footer links background.
- Pesky Android Oreo announcements now darkened.

2017-08-08:
- Fixed below target API level colours.

2017-07-30:
- Changed the sidebar links colour so it's easier to read.
- Reused the search box icon sprite image after discovering there's a white one available.
